page.title: 01GENERAL INTRODUCTRION
page.content: The area we have surveyed is extremely diverse in appearence.To the west in the vicinity of Iver there is farmland, a manor house,a yacht club and a sewage works all spanned by the recently built M25.In the north of the area is Brunel University, named after I.K.Brunel who was the engineer responsible for building the Great Western Railway during the last century.This railway line,now forming the Western Region of British Rail,runs through West Drayton in the very south of our area.Hillingdon Hospital is a large and modern building in the centre of our area and from its roof it is possible to clearly see Heathrow International Airport and all of our area.
